response.job_title: Food Science & Technology Researcher | Food Innovation | Product and Process Development | Project Management
response.summary: Master in Food Innovation and Product Design with R&D experience in food, packaging and cosmetic industry. Passioned about research with a results-oriented approach, problem-solving skills and analytical way of thinking. Leadership skills and good interpersonal relationships. Interested in the fields of food product design, food science and technology , project management and marketing. Languages: Spanish native speaker, English C1, Portuguese C1, French B2.
response.skills: Product conceptualization, Molecular Gastronomy, Innovation, Food processing, Process Engineering, Manufacturing Scale-up, Project Evaluation, Formulation, Bakery Science, Food Microbiology, Sensory Evaluation, Research Skills, Food Science, Food Technology, Product Development, Project Management, Team Leadership, Gestión de proyectos, Desarrollo de productos, Consumer Products

company.name: SSICA - Research Foundation
company.description:
The Experimental Station for the Food Preserving Industry (SSICA) is a Research Foundation, whose operates on the national territory through its headquarter in Parma and the local unit in Angri (SA).

Founded in 1922 with the mission of providing scientific and technological support to the Italian food industry, the institute has been carrying out for over a century activities of experimental development, consultancy, transfer of results, technological training and dissemination with the aim of providing answers to the general problems concerning the processing activity, intervening throughout the production chain of agri-food to improve quality and safety standards.

Our specialized areas of activity divided by product sectors and cross-sectoral and multidisciplinary topics include: Animal Preserves, Vegetable Preserves, Sea and Fish Preserves, Sustainability and Enhancement (Environment and Packaging), Microbiology, Technological Development, Chemical Safety, Metrology, Accreditation and Quality System, Labelling, Marketing and Consumer Science.

SSICA has about 100 employees, among researchers and administrative staff and is supporting more than 3600 companies of the national preserving food industry, developing research projects also at European level.

Disclaimer: e welcome your feedback but please be aware that we may not always be able to take part in discussions. The best way to reach us is through the Contact Us section of our website (info > Contacts). Any form of harassment, written attacks, insults, vulgarity or indecency will be removed. In addition, any link or reference to third-party products or services will be removed.
